name: Afghani
description: Afghani is a heavy indica strain named after its geographic origin, where the earliest varieties of cannabis are believed to have grown. Breeders worldwide have come to treasure Afghani for its heavy resin production which is passed on genetically. With a sweet, earthy aroma, Afghani delivers a deep, sedating relaxation and euphoria. Patients most commonly turn to this potent indica to treat insomnia, pain, and stress disorders.
descriptionPlain: Afghani is a heavy indica strain named after its geographic origin, where the earliest varieties of cannabis are believed to have grown. Breeders worldwide have come to treasure Afghani for its heavy resin production which is passed on genetically. With a sweet, earthy aroma, Afghani delivers a deep, sedating relaxation and euphoria. Patients most commonly turn to this potent indica to treat insomnia, pain, and stress disorders.

highlightedReviews.text:
I suffer from terrible insomnia and Afghani is by far the best I've tried for this.  Normal "couchlock" indicas seem to have very little sedative effect on me, but this Afghani stuff has managed to actually WORK :).  All most of the other ones did was get me high and make me even more awake.  Not Afghani.  Took about a tenth of a gram 20 minutes ago and I'm feeling like I will be able to sleep tonight.  No big, destracting "high", either.  Very clear-headed and lucid.  You feel that it is there, and it is intense in it's own way, but again, incredibly lucid and not scatterbrained at all.  Perfect for studying.  Highly focused.
The body effects, however, are QUITE strong :).  I feel physically somewhat drunk, but in a pleasant way - no pukiness, impaired judgement or any malaise whatsoever like you'd get with alchohol, but extremely lazy, a bit sleepy, coordination is a little off, eyes are droopy as hell.  Very mild tingling sensations - woah, a body buzz...cool :).   I'm someone that can smoke just about any other indica dominant strain and get almost no body buzz at all, yet am quite sensitive to the mind-altering effects.  Afghani is a perfect match for me.  I'm ready to get some sleep and there's no craziness going on in my head.  No trippiness.  No anxiety whatsoever.  This will be my insomnia medication for sure!

This strain was very popular years ago in my area (and in high school iirc..) before I used Leafly, and was such a well known and ubiquitous strain I just never really thought to bother with a review of this particular strain- until, a recently gifted specimen of some delicious, beauuuutiful, indoor Afghani was gifted to me by my Pops.

Now I have a lot of anxiety issues and panic attack type of problems, and sometimes heavy (and rather embarrassingly on occasion, even NOT that heavy sometimes) Sativas and Sativa-dominant strains will often rocket right into being “Uncomfortably Numb” in a big way.

So I’m just very big into that super cool, far out, stoney, groovy, righteousness is Indicas. Ahhh hells yusssss. 

And man this was the first time in a LONG time since I’d had some good, purple, STICKY Afghani, and it just really reminded me everything I love so much about Indica strains. Not quite couch locked, just... relaxed, feelin’ smooth, feelin’ goooooood maaaan. Like I’m sinking into a warm jacuzzi or something like that. 

Had some gnarly ass munchies, killed an obscene amount of fuggin’ milkshakes... I regretted that in the morning but hey, the future’s uncertain and The End is always near! ⏳👁☠️⚰️🗿🌑⌛️

articles.title: New Strains Alert: Hawaiian Dream, Blue Afghani, Maui Bubble Gift, God's Green Crack, and More
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
We have some new strains in the database that need your reviews! From the west coast to the U.S.'s northeastern tip, these recent additions span the geographic spectrum. Check out all the other newly added strains in our Explorer and leave a review for those that you've tried!
 
   1. God's Green Crack

God’s Green Crack is a balanced hybrid strain bred by Jordan of the Islands, who wanted to lighten up the heavy effects of God’s Gift with a high-flying Green Crack sativa. The indica and sativa parents work together to deliver a duality of head and body effects that lift the mood while relaxing muscles. Its buds take on a deep purple coloration toward the end of its maturation, especially when raised in lower temperatures.

 
   2. Hawaiian Dream

Hawaiian Dream is an uplifting sativa strain that crosses Blue Dream with a Hawaiian variety. Though some renditions of this strain have a THC-dominant chemical profile, Hawaiian Dream is best known for its high CBD content which is often twice as abundant as its THC. Patients look to this high-CBD sativa to remedy pain, inflammation, and anxiety without physical heaviness or a foggy head.

 
   3. Maui Bubble Gift

Maui Bubble Gift is an indica-dominant hybrid strain whose known parent strains include Bubble Gum and a Maui Waui/God’s Gift hybrid. This strain’s CBD content often outweighs its THC levels, making it a great match for consumers with pain, anxiety, and inflammation. With only mildly psychoactive effects, Maui Bubble Gift delivers its soothing relief alongside an earthy, floral aroma.

 
   4. Blue Afghani

Bred by Jordan of the Islands in Canada, Blue Afghani is an indica-dominant strain that combines genetics from Blueberry and Afghani. Its stout plants produce dense, resinous buds that fill your nose with a sweet and spicy berry aroma. Next come the powerful full-body effects that keep you anchored in relaxation while pain, anxiety, and stress float away.

 
   5. Predator Pink

A cross between Plushberry and Starfighter, Predator Pink by Exotic Genetix is a 60/40 indica-dominant hybrid with a tropical candy flavor. Though less common than its green counterpart, some phenotypes express themselves in pastel pink and fuchsia hues. Beginning with a lift of the spirit and buzzing cerebral energy, Predator Pink’s effects eventually make their descent into meditative relaxation.

 
   6. Mother of Berries

Mother of Berries, or M.O.B., is an indica strain from Maine that provides a deeply relaxing experience that transitions well into restful sleep. Carrying the legacy of its Blueberry parent, Mother of Berries lives up to its name with its unmistakable blueberry fragrance. Its chunky buds are wreathed in interweaving hues of purple and green, which are obscured under a dense blanket of crystal trichomes. With effects that are more mellow than jarring, Mother of Berries is suitable for both novice and seasoned consumers alike.

 
   7. Eugene Cream

Eugene Cream is an indica-dominant strain grown by Drift Away Farm. Named for its light color and smooth smoke, Eugene Cream inherits its characteristics from a Hash Plant/Big Bud hybrid and a female plant called Queen. Several years of selective breeding gave rise to the stable phenotype that now circulates the Oregon market.

articles.title: New Strains Alert: CBD Shark, Afghan Hawaiian, 13 Dawgs, Damn Sour, and More
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
The Leafly strain database now exceeds 1,200 varieties, but our collection is far from finished. These ten strains are only a few among many newly added varieties, so don't forget to check out all of the other newcomers in the Explorer!
 
   1. CBD Shark
Characteristics of CBD Shark:

80/20 high-CBD indica-dominant strain
Cross between Shark Shock and an unknown high-CBD variety
Fruity, herbal aroma
Clear-headed, soothing effects
May help with pain, anxiety, and inflammation

 
   2. Afghan Hawaiian
Characteristics of Afghan Hawaiian:

Indica-dominant strain
Cross between UK Cheese and Lavender
Sweet and earthy cheese aroma
Euphoric and relaxing
May help with neurological disorders and spasticity

 
   3. 13 Dawgs
Characteristics of 13 Dawgs:

Indica-dominant hybrid
Cross between G13 and Chemdawg
Woody, citrus aroma
Happy, relaxed, focused effects
May help with depression and appetite loss

 
   4. Damn Sour
Characteristics of Damn Sour:

Mostly sativa strain
Bred from Sage N Sour genetics
Sour, diesel aroma
Uplifting and intensely euphoric
May help with aches and appetite loss

 
   5. Afghani CBD
Characteristics of Afghani CBD:

High-CBD variant of the landrace indica Afghani
Earthy, hashy aroma
Relaxing, therapeutic properties
May help with insomnia, chronic pain, and stress disorders

 
   6. Aberdeen
Characteristics of Aberdeen:

Variety of Agent Orange
Cross between Orange Velvet and Jack the Ripper
Sweet orange and citrus aroma
Happy, uplifting effects
May help with anxiety, migraines, and gastrointestinal disorders

 
   7. Jenni
Characteristics of Jenni:

Mostly sativa strain
Modest THC level suitable for novice consumers
Sweet, fruity aroma
Soothing, clear-headed effects

 
   8. Bedica
Characteristics of Bedica:

Mostly indica strain
Sedating, calming effects
May help with stress and insomnia

 
   9. Avi
Characteristics of Avi:

50/50 high-CBD hybrid strain
Sweet fruit and berry aroma
Relaxing and calming effects
May help with body aches and pains

 
   10. Argyle
Characteristics of Argyle:

Indica-dominant high-CBD hybrid
Variety of Nordle (cross between Afghani and Sensi Star)
Herbal, fruity aroma
Mellow, calming buzz
May help with pain and muscle spasms
